cmp: 子 (11 p.m.-1 a.m./1st earthly branch/child/midnight/son/child/seed/egg/small thing, (noun suff.))

exm.mng: grandson, descendant
surname Sun
eldest grandson, the eldest son of one's eldest son
two-character surname Zhangsun
offspring, posterity
daughter's daughter, granddaughter
daughter's son, grandson, descendant via the female line
Sun Quan (reigned 222-252), southern warlord and king of state of Wu 吳|吴 in the Three Kingdoms period
grandson, son's son

Sun Tzu, also known as Sun Wu 孫武|孙武[Sun1 Wu3] (c. 500 BC, dates of birth and death uncertain), general, strategist and philosopher of the Spring and Autumn Period (700-475 BC), believed to be the author of the “Art of War” 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3], one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
son's daughter, granddaughter
Sun Wukong, the Monkey King, character with supernatural powers in the novel Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4], Son Goku, the main character in Dragon Ball 七龍珠|七龙珠[Qi1 long2 zhu1]
two-character surname Gongsun
Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党, same as 孫逸仙|孙逸仙
descendant
”Art of War”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wǔ jīng Qī Shū], written by Sun Tzu 孫子|孙子[Sūn zǐ]
Descendants of the Fiery Emperor and Yellow Emperor (i.e. Han Chinese people)
Sun Yue (1973-), PRC female pop star, Sun Yue (1985-), PRC basketball star, plays for Los Angeles Lakers from 2007
Sun Jian (155-191), famous general at end of Han dynasty, forerunner of the southern kingdom of Wu of the Three Kingdoms
great-grandson
